text:
Did anyone else notice that Google created MuZero that’s an improved version of AlphaZero, and uses reinforcement learning?
<https://arstechnica.com/science/2020/12/google-develops-an-ai-that-can-learn-both-chess-and-pac-man/>

attachments.title: Google develops an AI that can learn both chess and Pac-Man
attachments.text: MuZero handles both rules-based and open-ended games.
attachments.fallback: Ars Technica: Google develops an AI that can learn both chess and Pac-Man

elements.text: Did anyone else notice that Google created MuZero that’s an improved version of AlphaZero, and uses reinforcement learning?

text: These are personally significant. I play Go, and before AlphaGo won Lee Sedol I believed it would take computers ten years to beat humans. (I’m not particularly good, just 5 kyu.)

elements.text: These are personally significant. I play Go, and before AlphaGo won Lee Sedol I believed it would take computers ten years to beat humans. (I’m not particularly good, just 5 kyu.)

text: I hope Google releases a collection of games with AlphaZero against MuZero! (Chess and Go)

elements.text: I hope Google releases a collection of games with AlphaZero against MuZero! (Chess and Go)

text: Yup, MuZero has been out for a while now. They even released a follow-up of sorts generalizing the approach further.

elements.text: Yup, MuZero has been out for a while now. They even released a follow-up of sorts generalizing the approach further.

text: Not sure why tech news is picking up on it just now. I suspect PR did a press blitz when it got published at NeurIPS?

elements.text: Not sure why tech news is picking up on it just now. I suspect PR did a press blitz when it got published at NeurIPS?

text: I think they have a Nature release on it now, but before was just a preprint?

elements.text: I think they have a Nature release on it now, but before was just a preprint?

text: I mean, preprints haven't stopped tech press before. Also this trend of publishing on Nature is just bizarre to me. Feels like more of a reflection of DeepMind/Google's hype machine and deep pockets than anything

elements.text: I mean, preprints haven't stopped tech press before. Also this trend of publishing on Nature is just bizarre to me. Feels like more of a reflection of DeepMind/Google's hype machine and deep pockets than anything

text: On the other hand, when you have 10K to spare (as Google probably does), a Nature publication definitely seems like the way to go!

elements.text: On the other hand, when you have 10K to spare (as Google probably does), a Nature publication definitely seems like the way to go!

text: Yeah, high impact and low scrutiny...

elements.text: Yeah, high impact and low scrutiny...

text: I think Nature's reputation was stained pretty badly by that earthquake prediction paper a while back. Regardless, it's pretty clear this venue was chosen for PR value first and not rigour.

elements.text: I think Nature's reputation was stained pretty badly by that earthquake prediction paper a while back. Regardless, it's pretty clear this venue was chosen for PR value first and not rigour.
